abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Reservoir Maintenance
            Facilities Project for Pakistan was successful. The project
            achieved its main objectives, its impact has been
            substantial, sustainability is likely, and the performance
            of the Bank and Borrower was very satisfactory. Several
            lessons can be learned from this project. First, in the
            future, the Government of Pakistan (GOP) should consider
            issuing the No Objection Certificates (NOC) on the list of
            equipment submitted by the project authority after the
            approval of the project PC-1. Second, for projects involving
            large procurement activities, the project authorities should
            be encouraged to appoint a special procurement
            officer/expediter from the start of project implementation.
            Third, the GOP should let WAPDA (Water and Power Development
            Authority) keep a certain percentage of its annual revenue
            from the sale of electricity generated at the Tarbela and
            Mangla Dams. Fourth, GOP/WAPDA should continue annual and
            periodic dam safety inspections. Fifth, WAPDA should place
            its best qualified and experienced engineers and technicians
            on the O&M (Operation & Maintenance) and safety
            monitoring of the three dams. Lastly, the Bank should
            establish guidelines concerning the exchange of information
            between parallel co-financiers and the Bank.
